revenue.question: Which month in 2017 had the highest recorded revenue?
revenue.answer: August 2017 had the highest recorded revenue with $3,131,402.33.

revenue.question: How did the yearly revenue change from 2015 to 2017?
revenue.answer: Revenue increased from $4,885,517.06 in 2015 to $15,291,176.01 in 2016, then slightly declined to $14,284,246.24 in 2017.

revenue.question: Which hotel type generated more revenue?
revenue.answer: City hotels generated more revenue ($18,774,101.54) than resort hotels ($15,686,837.77).

revenue.question: Which market segment contributed the highest revenue?
revenue.answer: Online Travel Agencies (OTA) contributed the highest revenue with $22,266,636.88.

revenue.question: What percentage of total revenue came from canceled bookings?
revenue.answer: Approximately 33% of the total revenue came from canceled bookings.

revenue.question: What was the revenue in July 2017?

cancellations.question: What is the overall cancellation rate in the dataset?
Which hotel type has a higher cancellation rate?
cancellations.answer: City hotels have a higher cancellation rate (30.04%) than resort hotels (23.48%).

cancellations.question: During which month in 2017 was the cancellation rate highest?
cancellations.answer: August 2017 had the highest cancellation rate at 36.75%.

cancellations.question: How does lead time affect cancellation rates?
cancellations.answer: Long-term bookings (lead time > 30 days) have the highest cancellation rate at 34.76%, while last-minute bookings (<7 days) have the lowest at 8.13%.

cancellations.question: What is the cancellation rate for non-refundable deposit bookings?
cancellations.answer: Non-refundable deposit bookings have a cancellation rate of 94.7%.

geo.question: Which country had the highest number of bookings?
geo.answer: Portugal had the highest number of bookings with 27,453.

geo.question: What percentage of total bookings came from the United Kingdom?
geo.answer: The United Kingdom accounted for 11.94% of total bookings.

geo.question: Which country generated the most revenue?
geo.answer: Portugal generated the most revenue with $9,082,328.96.

geo.question: Name one country with a 100% cancellation rate.
During which months did bookings from Portugal peak?
geo.answer: Bookings from Portugal peaked in July and August.

lead_time.question: What is the overall average lead time for bookings?
lead_time.answer: The overall average lead time is 79.89 days.

lead_time.question: Which lead time range had the highest number of bookings?
lead_time.answer: The 1 to 3 months range had the highest number of bookings with 22,744 bookings.

lead_time.question: What percentage of bookings are made less than a week before arrival?
lead_time.answer: 19.58% of bookings are made less than a week before arrival.

lead_time.question: Which hotel type has a longer average lead time?
lead_time.answer: Resort hotels have a longer average lead time of 83.37 days compared to city hotels at 77.68 days.

lead_time.question: How does lead time impact cancellation rates?
lead_time.answer: Longer lead times have higher cancellation rates (34.76% for bookings over 30 days), while last-minute bookings have the lowest cancellation rate at 8.13%.

others.question: How does the number of special requests affect cancellation rates?
others.answer: Guests with more special requests are less likely to cancel. For example, the cancellation rate drops from 33.20% (0 requests) to 5.56% (5 requests).

others.question: What is the cancellation rate for guests with no special requests?
others.answer: Guests with no special requests have a cancellation rate of 33.20%.

others.question: Which deposit type has the highest cancellation rate?
others.answer: Non-refundable deposits have the highest cancellation rate at 94.70%.

others.question: What is the cancellation rate for refundable deposit bookings?
others.answer: Refundable deposit bookings have a cancellation rate of 24.30%.

others.question: How does lead time influence the likelihood of cancellations?
others.answer: Longer lead times are associated with higher cancellation rates. Bookings made more than 30 days in advance have a 34.76% cancellation rate, while last-minute bookings (<7 days) have only 8.13%.
